discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
CND Page 1827
Frequency-hopping Spread Spectrum A local area wireless network (LAWN) uses the frequency-hopping spread spectrum (FHSS) modulation technique. The transmission hop in FHSS occurs several times per second, allowing devices in a short range to work efficiently. Large systems using the same frequency do not affect the working of small devices.

Selected Answer: A
A local area wireless network (LAWN) uses the frequency-hopping spread spectrum (FHSS) modulation technique
A local area wireless network (LAWN) uses the frequency-hopping spread spectrum (FHSS) modulation technique. cnd book page 1827
